notesStmt.note: Lines are well spaced, as in the style of official letters; From a letter to the Nagid Mevorakh ben Sa'adia, who served in this office between 1094-1111. The first three lines are the name of the Nagid with his honorary titles. See M. Cohen: Jewish self-government in medieval Egypt : the origins of the office of head of the Jews, ca. 1065-1126 / Mark R. Cohen. Princeton : Princeton University Press, 1980, p. 139-148 (n.138).
Condition: fragment, only right edge is intact, lower edge appears to be torn along fold line; verso is blank.
